text:
Hi, my name is Emmy, and welcome to the Ray 
Dashboard Walkthrough Series. In this video,

we're going to cover one of my favorite 
views which is the "Metrics" tab.

Under "Metrics," I can see this real time updating 
information about the state of my cluster,

as well as my Ray application. Up first, I can 
see my tasks and actors, so I can look at active

tasks by name for instance, and I can see that 
there are 14 active tasks. For each of these

time series metrics, I can reduce the time frame 
or expand it according to what I'm interested in.

In my next section, I can look at my Ray 
resource usage, so if I'm particularly curious

about my object store memory or my scheduler 
CPUs, this would be a great place to look.

And the third section is my hardware utilization, 
so if you're particularly sensitive to out of

memory issues for instance, this would be a 
great place to look and monitor your application.

You can also view these time 
series metrics in Grafana,

and if I open this up, I'm able to do far more 
extensive configuring of exactly what I want to

see, as well as set-up custom metrics. That covers 
the key features of the metrics tab. If you're

interested in the other views, check out the other 
videos in our series. And I'll see you next time.
